common.tagline: Video-based kinematic analysis for athletic performance

athleteProfile.title: Athlete Profile (Optional)
athleteProfile.hint: Providing athlete information improves the accuracy of coaching recommendations.

errors.invalidFileType: Please select a valid video file

results.heading: Analysis Results
results.issuesDetected: Issues detected that may affect accuracy.

feedback.heading: Share Your Feedback
feedback.helpText: Help us improve Kinemotion by sharing your experience and suggestions

database.defaultMessage: Coach feedback and data storage features are currently unavailable.

dj_height_limiter.title: Jump height is the main limiter
dj_height_limiter.description: Strong reactive ability suggests a lower-body power deficit rather than a technique issue. Focus on building strength through squats, lunges, and basic plyometrics ‚Äî your fast stretch-shortening cycle is an asset to build on.

dj_rsi_limiter.title: Reactive strength needs work
dj_rsi_limiter.description: Good jump height but slow ground contact indicates the stretch-shortening cycle needs improvement. Work on ankle stiffness drills, quick-response hops, and low-intensity plyometrics.

dj_both_weak.title: Both reactive strength and jump height need development
dj_both_weak.description: Build a general strength and power base first. Focus on squats, lunges, and landing mechanics before progressing to plyometric training.

dj_rsi_strength.title: Reactive strength is a clear strength
dj_rsi_strength.description: The stretch-shortening cycle is functioning well ‚Äî fast transitions from landing to takeoff.

dj_gct_strength.title: Excellent ground contact efficiency
dj_gct_strength.description: Very fast ground contact time shows strong ankle stiffness and efficient force application. This is a key asset for reactive sports movements.

dj_gct_limiter.title: Ground contact time is too long
dj_gct_limiter.description: Slow ground contact suggests weak ankle stiffness or poor SSC utilization. Practice quick-response drills, ankle hops, and focus on minimizing ground time.

dj_gct_observation.title: Ground contact time is moderate
dj_gct_observation.description: Room for improvement in ground contact efficiency. Incorporate ankle stiffness drills and cue faster ground contacts during plyometric training.

cmj_height_limiter.title: Jump height is limiting performance
cmj_height_limiter.description: Decent velocity suggests technique is reasonable, but force production needs work. Focus on lower-body strength training (squats, deadlifts) and contrast training methods.

cmj_velocity_limiter.title: Takeoff velocity is the limiter
cmj_velocity_limiter.description: Adequate jump height despite low velocity suggests good technique. Improve rate of force development with explosive training ‚Äî jump squats, Olympic lift variations, and ballistic exercises.

cmj_depth_too_deep.title: Countermovement is too deep
cmj_depth_too_deep.description: Excessive depth is slowing the stretch-shortening cycle and reducing power transfer. Cue a quicker, shallower countermovement ‚Äî think 'quick dip' rather than deep squat.

cmj_depth_too_shallow.title: Countermovement is too shallow
cmj_depth_too_shallow.description: Shallow countermovement limits elastic energy storage. Cue a deeper squat to use full range of motion ‚Äî the athlete may be rushing the jump.

cmj_depth_optimal.title: Countermovement depth is well-calibrated
cmj_depth_optimal.description: Good trade-off between depth and speed in the countermovement phase. Maintain this pattern.

cmj_power_strength.title: Excellent power production
cmj_power_strength.description: Both jump height and velocity are strong ‚Äî lower-body power and technique are working well together. Focus on maintaining this capacity and sport-specific application.

sj_height_limiter.title: Jump height may be limited by technique
sj_height_limiter.description: Reasonable velocity but lower height could indicate inefficient force application from the static start. Focus on improving starting position mechanics and concentric force development.

sj_velocity_limiter.title: Concentric velocity needs improvement
sj_velocity_limiter.description: Good height despite low velocity suggests room for improvement in explosive strength. Focus on rate of force development with jump squats and ballistic training.

sj_power_strength.title: Strong concentric power output
sj_power_strength.description: Both height and velocity are strong from a static start ‚Äî excellent pure concentric power. This translates well to acceleration and explosive movements.

errors.networkError: Unable to connect to the analysis server. Please check your internet connection and try again.
errors.serverError: Server error occurred during analysis. Please try again or contact support if the issue persists.
errors.fileTooLarge: Video file is too large. Please use a video smaller than 500MB.
errors.invalidRequest: Invalid video file or request. Please ensure you selected a valid video file.
errors.timeout: Analysis took too long. Please try with a shorter video or try again later.
errors.contactSupport: If this problem persists, please contact support with the following information:

jumpHeightM.label: Jump Height (m)
jumpHeightM.description: Maximum height achieved during the jump

jumpHeightCm.label: Jump Height (cm)
jumpHeightCm.description: Maximum height achieved during the jump

flightTimeMs.label: Flight Time (ms)
flightTimeMs.description: Time spent in the air during the jump

flightTimeS.label: Flight Time (s)
flightTimeS.description: Time spent in the air during the jump

groundContactTimeMs.label: Ground Contact Time
groundContactTimeMs.description: Time with feet in contact with the ground

reactiveStrengthIndex.label: RSI
reactiveStrengthIndex.description: Jump height divided by ground contact time

takeoffVelocityMps.label: Takeoff Velocity
takeoffVelocityMps.description: Vertical velocity at the moment of takeoff

countermovementDepthM.label: Countermovement Depth (m)
countermovementDepthM.description: Depth of the squat during countermovement

countermovementDepthCm.label: Countermovement Depth (cm)
countermovementDepthCm.description: Depth of the squat during countermovement

landingForceNormalized.label: Landing Force
landingForceNormalized.description: Landing force relative to body weight

peakPowerW.label: Peak Power
peakPowerW.description: Maximum power output during the jump

peakEccentricVelocityMs.label: Peak Eccentric Velocity
peakEccentricVelocityMs.description: Maximum velocity during the downward phase

peakConcentricVelocityMs.label: Peak Concentric Velocity
peakConcentricVelocityMs.description: Maximum velocity during the upward phase

transitionTimeMs.label: Transition Time
transitionTimeMs.description: Time between end of eccentric and start of concentric phase

lowestPointFrame.label: Lowest Point Frame
lowestPointFrame.description: Frame number at lowest point of squat

loading.estimatedTime: This typically takes 10-60 seconds depending on video length

errorBoundary.heading: Something went wrong
